selected_quotes: Efficacy Safety of Surgical Decompression in Patients with CSM:Results of

citation.abstract: Cervical spondylotic myelopathy is the leading cause of spinal cord dysfunction worldwide. The objective of this study was to evaluate the impact of surgical decompression on functional, quality-of-life, and disability outcomes at one year after surgery in a large cohort of patients with this condition.
citation.journal: Journal of Bone & Joint Surgery, American Volume
citation.publisher: The Journal of Bone and Joint Surgery
citation.title: Efficacy and Safety of Surgical Decompression in Patients with Cervical Spondylotic Myelopathy

facebook.title: The Journal of Bone & Joint Surgery | Efficacy and Safety of Surgical Decompression in Patients...
facebook.summary: In cervical spondylotic myelopathy, surgical decompression was associated with improvement in functional, disability-related, and quality-of-life outcomes at one year of follow-up for all disease severity categories http://jbjs.org/article.aspx?articleID=1

author.name: 門 祐輔
author.description: 2017年5月2〜4日の萩往還250kmウルトラマラニック、何とか完踏したが体はガタガタ。今後は年齢を考え穏やかな下り坂モードへ。片道3.2kmのジョギング通勤は継続予定の医師不足99床病院長。

author.name: Michael G. Fehlings

news.title: Surgery helps common arthritis-related spinal disease
news.summary: TORONTO - Decompression surgery is a safe, effective means of treating a common but often misdiagnosed disease of the spine that can lead to paralysis, a Canadian-led international study concludes.

wikipedia.title: Myelopathy
wikipedia.summary: Myelopathy describes any neurologic deficit related to the spinal cord. When due to trauma, it is known as (acute) spinal cord injury.
